com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.utilities

Class SystemDrawableUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.utilities.SystemDrawableUtilities

  • public class SystemDrawableUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for getting system icons and coloring them (IE a back button) Created by pmacdowell on 8/12/2016.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SystemDrawableUtilities() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ImageView getSearchMagnifierIcon(android.support.v7.widget.SearchView searchView)
      Gets the searchview's standars search magnifying glass icon that is used by the system.
      static Drawable getToolbarBackArrow(Context context, int colorToSet)
      Gets the toolbar's standard back-arrow icon, sets the color to whatever is passed in, and returns it
      static Drawable getToolbarBackArrow(Context context, java.lang.String colorToSet)
      Overloaded method for passing in String colors
      static View getToolbarHamburgerButton(Activity activity)
      Get the hamburger icon and return it (Used for setting colors to it)
      static void setSearchMagnifierIcon(android.support.v7.widget.SearchView searchView, int resIdToSet)
      Sets the searchview's magnifier icon via getting it first by passing searchview and then setting it via the passed int (IE a drawable formatted like this: R.drawable.textfield_searchview_holo_light )

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getToolbarBackArrow

        public static Drawable getToolbarBackArrow(Context context,
                                           java.lang.String colorToSet)
        Overloaded method for passing in String colors
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to reference the resources
        colorToSet - String of a color to parse and then set
        Returns:
        Drawable to be set. Use null to set to default color

      • getToolbarBackArrow

        public static Drawable getToolbarBackArrow(Context context,
                                           int colorToSet)
        Gets the toolbar's standard back-arrow icon, sets the color to whatever is passed in, and returns it
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to reference the resources
        colorToSet - int of a color to set
        Returns:
        Drawable to be set. Use -1 to set to default color

      • getSearchMagnifierIcon

        public static ImageView getSearchMagnifierIcon(android.support.v7.widget.SearchView searchView)
        Gets the searchview's standars search magnifying glass icon that is used by the system. References the searchview
        Parameters:
        searchView - Searchview being altered
        Returns:
        A View which can be altered

      • setSearchMagnifierIcon

        public static void setSearchMagnifierIcon(android.support.v7.widget.SearchView searchView,
                                          int resIdToSet)
        Sets the searchview's magnifier icon via getting it first by passing searchview and then setting it via the passed int (IE a drawable formatted like this: R.drawable.textfield_searchview_holo_light )
        Parameters:
        searchView - The searchview to be altering
        resIdToSet - The resource id to set
